Summary I like making things work better and do so with an unusual, dual career blend in corporate and family services settings. In the corporate world, I am a customer-focused Project Manager and leverage my attention to detail, adaptability, solid communication skills, and ability to liaise effectively between business and IS staff. As a PM, I build systems and tools to collect and analyze complicated data; use the results to develop appropriate metrics to enable effective decision making; and lead related process improvement projects. In the family services world, I am passionate about helping parents learn effective ways to raise children who thrive. I accomplish this by teaching a proven, research-based parenting approach and providing a counseling practice aimed at removing each client’s obstacles to success. 
 
Project Manager strengths: 
• Agile project management (RUP) 
• Stakeholder interviewing/requirements gathering 
• Use case scenario and test script development 
• Metrics tracking and reporting systems 
• Business Process Management (BPM)/Business Process Reengineering (BPR) 
• Workflow mapping 
• Operational analytics 
• Data aggregation/consolidation 
 
Marriage and Family Therapy strengths: 
• Relationship building and strengthening 
• Individual, couple, and family therapy 
• Emotional intelligence 
• Mindfulness 
• Re-regulation strategies 
• Parenting education and coaching 
• Integration of brain development principles, connection, and empathy to improve treatment outcomes 
 
Shared strengths: 
• Conflict resolution 
• Training and workshop facilitation Summary I like making things work better and do so with an unusual, dual career blend in corporate and family services settings.
